summary: A lighting modification focused on realistically lit days, nights, and everything in between. Don\'t just play Skyrim, Become Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/20699]Become Skyrim 1.2 - A Realistic ENB[/url]

This is my own personal ENB that I have been slowly learning and tweaking as I play. I finally got to a point where I felt it looked fairly nice and I decided to release it publicly. Any suggestions or comments are welcome!

Installation: 
-Download ENB .113 from the official website, open the wrapper version folder, then extract d3d9.dll to your Skyrim directory (Default path is C:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim)
[url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0113.htm]http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0113.htm[/url]

-Extract all files from Become Skyrim 1.2.zip to your Skyrim directory 

-Browse to C:\\Users\\%userprofile%\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim, open skyrim.ini then search for this value and change it to match
[Water]
bReflectSky=1

-Now open skyrimprefs.ini, search for these values and change them to match
[Display]
bDrawLandShadows=1
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
fGamma=1.0000

-Open the Skyrim launcher, click Data Files and check the boxes for BS-Torch.esp, Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp, and Realistic Lighting.esp, then click OK

-This step is optional, but highly recommended. ADJUST YOUR MONITOR BRIGHTNESS/CONTRAST. An uncalibrated monitor can cause images to be washed out, or unusually dark. Lagom.nl has a very nice suite of test patterns to aid calibration. Browse to [url=http://www.lagom.nl/lcd-test/black.php]http://www.lagom.nl/lcd-test/black.php[/url] then open [url=http://www.lagom.nl/lcd-test/white.php]http://www.lagom.nl/lcd-test/white.php[/url] in a new tab. Fiddle with your monitor\'s brightness/contrast levels until all black and white patterns are distinctly visible. You may also try adjusting your video card\'s brightness/contrast/gamma settings as well. NOTE: Your monitor may not be capable of displaying both the darkest darks and the whitest whites at the same time (or at all). In this case, try to find an acceptable middle-ground.

Uninstall:
-Simply delete all files that were added by this mod



Thanks to...
Boris Vorontsov for creating ENB, none of this would be possible without him!
[url=http://enbdev.com/index_en.html]ENB Series[/url]

Matso for use of his bloom in my mod 
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19379 ]Imvisio ENB[/url]

The Realistic Lighting team for graciously allowing RL 3.4a to be used freely
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7654]Realistic Lighting With Customization[/url]
author: Weedhopper
